Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transfected with wild-type and mutant PINK1 constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.W225X variant caused a complete loss of PINK1 protein expression and mitochondrial function.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated three times with independent cell cultures.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1 was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector transfection was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used for comparing mutant vs. wild-type groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: PINK1 protein expression ≥ 80% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: PINK1 protein expression < 20% of wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Mitochondrial respiration was measured in HEK293 cells expressing PINK1 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: The p.W225X variant led to a 75% reduction in mitochondrial respiration rates compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each measurement was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type PINK1-expressing cells served as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Cells without PINK1 expression were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare mitochondrial respiration across groups.
